de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.jcomparser

Class Connector

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.database.DbObject
      • de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.database.DbDataObject
        • de.uni_potsdam.hpi.bpt.bp2014.jcomparser.Connector

  • public class Connector
extends DbDataObject
    The Connector has methods to create entries inside the database. Therefore it uses the database.Connection class.

        public Connector()

    • Method Detail

      • insertScenarioIntoDatabase

        public int insertScenarioIntoDatabase(java.lang.String name,
                             long modelID,
                             int modelVersion)
        A method to write a scenario to the database. The parameter are all the information needed to create a scenario entry.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the scenario.
        modelID - The ID used inside the xml representation.
        modelVersion - The version number of the model.
        Returns:
        returns the database id on success or -1 if insertion failed.

      • insertFragmentIntoDatabase

        public int insertFragmentIntoDatabase(java.lang.String fragmentName,
                             int scenarioID,
                             long modelID,
                             int modelVersion)
        Inserts a Fragment Into the Database. The parameters contain all necessary information.
        Parameters:
        fragmentName - The name of the fragment.
        scenarioID - The database id of the scenario (foreign key).
        modelID - The ID used for the fragment inside the xml.
        modelVersion - The version number of the model.
        Returns:
        returns the database id on success or -1 if insertion failed.

      • insertControlNodeIntoDatabase

        public int insertControlNodeIntoDatabase(java.lang.String label,
                                java.lang.String type,
                                int fragmentID,
                                long modelID)
        Inserts a Control Node into the Database. The Parameters contain all information for the insertion are given as a parameter
        Parameters:
        label - The label of the node.
        type - The type of the node (StartEvent/EndEvent/Task).
        fragmentID - The database ID of the Fragment.
        modelID - The modelID of the controlNode from the XML.
        Returns:
        The newly created database entry.

      • insertTerminationConditionIntoDatabase

        public void insertTerminationConditionIntoDatabase(int conditionID,
                                          int dataObjectID,
                                          int stateID,
                                          int scenarioID)
        This method inserts a termination condition into the database. Information necessary for the insertion are given to the database.
        Parameters:
        conditionID - The Id of the condition inside the model.
        dataObjectID - The Id of the dataObj. as a part of the condition.
        stateID - The ID of the state which is inside the condition.
        scenarioID - The Id of the scenario which has the term. condition.

      • insertControlFlowIntoDatabase

        public void insertControlFlowIntoDatabase(int sourceID,
                                 int targetID,
                                 java.lang.String condition)
        Inserts a control flow into the database. The parameters contain all necessary information.
        Parameters:
        sourceID - the database id of the sourceNode.
        targetID - the database id of the target node
        condition - the condition which is label of the flow.

      • insertDataObjectIntoDatabase

        public int insertDataObjectIntoDatabase(java.lang.String name,
                               int dataClassID,
                               int scenarioID,
                               int startStateID)
        Inserts a DataObject into the database. The necessary information will be given as parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the DataObject.
        dataClassID - The database Id of the class, which describes the DataObject.
        scenarioID - The database id of the scenario.
        startStateID - the database id of the initial State.
        Returns:
        the id of the newly created dataobject entry.

      • insertStateIntoDatabase

        public int insertStateIntoDatabase(java.lang.String name,
                          int dataClassId)
        This methods inserts a State into the Database. All needed information will be given as parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the state.
        dataClassId - The id of the class which can have the state.
        Returns:
        the database id of the newly created entry.

      • insertDataClassIntoDatabase

        public int insertDataClassIntoDatabase(java.lang.String name,
                              int root)
        Inserts a new Data Class into the database.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Class.
        Returns:
        the id of the newly created entry.

      • insertDataAttributeIntoDatabase

        public int insertDataAttributeIntoDatabase(java.lang.String name,
                                  int dataClassID,
                                  java.lang.String type)
        Inserts a new DataAttribute into the database.
        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the dataAttribute as a String.
        dataClassID - is the databaseID of the corresponding dataClass.
        type - is the type of the dataAttribute.
        Returns:
        the auto-incremented databaseID of the newly added dataAttribute.

      • insertDomainModelIntoDatabase

        public void insertDomainModelIntoDatabase(long modelID,
                                 int versionNumber,
                                 int scenarioID)
        Updates the scenario entry with the corresponding domainModel.
        Parameters:
        modelID - is the modelID of the domainModel which should be saved as a Long.
        versionNumber - is the versionNumber of the domainModel as an Integer.
        scenarioID - is the databaseID of the corresponding scenario.

      • insertAggregationIntoDatabase

        public void insertAggregationIntoDatabase(int sourceID,
                                 int targetID,
                                 int multiplicity)
        This method inserts an aggregation into the database.
        Parameters:
        sourceID - is the databaseID of a dataClass which is the source of the aggregation.
        targetID - is the databaseID of a dataClass which is the target of the aggregation.
        multiplicity - is the multiplicity of the aggregation as an Integer.

      • insertDataNodeIntoDatabase

        public int insertDataNodeIntoDatabase(int scenarioID,
                             int stateID,
                             int dataClassID,
                             int dataObjectID,
                             long modelID)
        This Methods inserts a new DataNode into the Database. All necessary information are given as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - The database Id of the corresponding scenario.
        stateID - The database Id of the state of the Node.
        dataClassID - The data class which describes the data object.
        dataObjectID - The data Object which is represented by the node.
        modelID - The modelID of the dataNode in the XML.
        Returns:
        the autoincrement id of the newly created entry.

      • insertDataSetIntoDatabase

        public int insertDataSetIntoDatabase(boolean isInput)
        Inserts a dataset into the database. Only a flag is needed which indicates, weather the set is an input or an output set.
        Parameters:
        isInput - true if input else false.
        Returns:
        The id of the newly created dataset entry.

      • insertDataSetConsistOfDataNodeIntoDatabase

        public void insertDataSetConsistOfDataNodeIntoDatabase(int dataSetID,
                                              int dataNodeID)
        Inserts a relation of a datanode to a dataset. All necessary information are given as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        dataSetID - the database id of the dataset.
        dataNodeID - the database id of the datanode.

      • insertDataFlowIntoDatabase

        public void insertDataFlowIntoDatabase(int controlNodeID,
                              int dataSetID,
                              boolean isInput)
        Inserts a new DataFlow into the database. All necessary information are provided by parameters.
        Parameters:
        controlNodeID - the id of the control node (source or target).
        dataSetID - the id of the dataSet (source or target).
        isInput - describes the direction, weather it is an input or output.

      • insertReferenceIntoDatabase

        public void insertReferenceIntoDatabase(int controlNodeID1,
                               int controlNodeID2)
        inserts a new Reference into the Database. The references describe the equivalence relation between tasks.
        Parameters:
        controlNodeID1 - the id of the first node.
        controlNodeID2 - the id of the second node.

        public int createEMailTemplate(int controlNodeId)
        Parameters:
        controlNodeId -
        Returns:

      • getFragmentVersion

        public int getFragmentVersion(int scenarioID,
                     long modelID)
        Get the version of a fragment which is in the database.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - databaseID of the scenario the fragment belongs to
        modelID - modelID of the fragment
        Returns:
        version of the specified fragment (return -1 if there is no fragment of this id)

      • getScenarioVersion

        public int getScenarioVersion(int scenarioID)
        Get the version of a scenario which is in the database.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - databaseID of the scenario
        Returns:
        version of the scenario with the scenarioID (return -1 if there is no scenario of this id)

      • getScenarioID

        public int getScenarioID(long scenarioID)
        Get the newest scenarioID for its modelId.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - modelID of the scenario
        Returns:
        the databaseID of the scenario for the LATEST version (we assume that the scenario with the largest id is the one of the newest version)

      • migrateScenarioInstance

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> migrateScenarioInstance(int oldScenarioID,
                                                        int newScenarioID)
        Change all oldScenarioIDs to newScenarioIDs of all running instances with oldScenarioID in table "scenarioinstance".
        Parameters:
        oldScenarioID - scenarioID that gets updated by newScenarioId
        newScenarioID - new scenarioID that overwrites oldScenarioId
        Returns:
        List of all IDs that running scenarioinstances of oldScenarioID hold

      • getFragmentID

        public int getFragmentID(int scenarioID,
                long modelID)
        Get the databaseId for the specified fragment in table "fragment".
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - the scenarioDatabaseID for which the fragment is selected
        modelID - the modelId of the fragment
        Returns:
        the databaseID of the selected fragment

      • migrateFragmentInstance

        public void migrateFragmentInstance(int oldFragmentID,
                           int newFragmentID)
        Change all oldFragmentIDs to newFragmentIDs of all running instances with oldFragmentID in table "fragmentinstance".
        Parameters:
        oldFragmentID - fragmentID that gets updated by newFragmentId
        newFragmentID - new fragmentID that overwrites oldFragmentId

      • insertFragmentInstance

        public void insertFragmentInstance(int fragmentID,
                          int instanceID)
        Insert a running instance of a fragment in table "fragmentinstance".
        Parameters:
        fragmentID - specifies a fragment the instance is running on
        instanceID - specifies a scenarioinstance the fragmentinstance belongs to

      • getControlNodeID

        public int getControlNodeID(int fragmentID,
                   long modelID)
        Get the databaseId for specified controlnode in table "controlnode".
        Parameters:
        fragmentID - the databaseID of the fragment the controlNode belongs to
        modelID - the modelId of the controlnode
        Returns:
        the databaseID of the selected controlnode

      • migrateControlNodeInstance

        public void migrateControlNodeInstance(int oldControlNodeID,
                              int newControlNodeID)
        Change all oldControlNodeIDs to newControlNodeIDs in table "controlnodeinstance".
        Parameters:
        oldControlNodeID - controlNodeID that gets updated by newControlNodeID
        newControlNodeID - new controlNodeID that overwrites oldControlNodeID

      • getDataObjectID

        public int getDataObjectID(int scenarioID,
                  java.lang.String dataObjectName)
        Get the dataobjectID of the specified dataObject in table "dataobject".
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - the scenarioDatabaseID for which the dataobjectID is selected
        dataObjectName - the name of the dataObject (we assume that a scenario can't hold dataObjects with the same name)
        Returns:
        the dataobject_id of the selected dataObject

      • migrateDataObjectInstance

        public void migrateDataObjectInstance(int oldDataObjectID,
                             int newDataObjectID)
        Change all oldDataObjectIDs to newDataObjectIDs in table "dataobjectinstance".
        Parameters:
        oldDataObjectID - dataobject_id that gets updated by newDataObjectID
        newDataObjectID - new dataobject_id that overwrites oldDataObjectID

        Returns:

      • isScenarioDeleted

        public int isScenarioDeleted(int scenarioID)
        Find out if the scenario in the database is marked a s deleted.
        Parameters:
        scenarioID - DatabaseID of the scenario
        Returns:
        The value of the deleted flag (1 if scenario is deleted; 0 otherwise)
